text.0: for you i call the glorious refulgent agni the guest of men rich in oblations.
text.1: whom all must strive to win even as a lover god among godly people jātavedas.
text.2: bhṛgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living.
text.3: over all worlds let agni be the sovran the messenger of gods with rapid coursers.
text.4: among the tribes of men the gods placed agni as a dear friend when they would dwell among them.
text.5: against the longing nights may he shine brightly and show the offerer in the house his vigour.
text.6: sweet is his growth as of ones own possessions his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely.
text.7: he darts his tongue forth like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail among the bushes.
text.8: since they who honour me have praised my greatnesshe gave as twere his hue to those who love him.
text.9: known is he by his bright delightful splendour and waxing old renews his youth for ever.
text.10: like one athirst he lighteth up the forests like water down the chariot ways he roareth.
text.11: on his black path he shines in burning beauty marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.
text.12: around consuming the broad earth he wanders free roaming like an ox without a herdsman.
text.13: agni refulgent burning up the bushes with blackened lines as though the earth he seasoned.
text.14: i in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly.
text.15: o agni give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.
text.16: may the gṛtsamadas serving in secret through thee o agni overcome their neighbours.
text.17: rich in good heroes and subduing foemen that vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.
